attributes.action: Push Back Brexit negotiations as resources should be directed to COVID-19 impact
attributes.additional_details:
Government should not have two major focuses (BREXIT/COVID-19) when events we are witnessing call for unity. 
The current crisis may impede negotiations efforts based on an abstract deadline set by the UK government.
The UK and EU should be focusing on rebuilding trust between people following measures such as isolation, and the impending impact across all aspects of life. 
In the next 12 months, government should focus on building resilience in the NHS to adequately protect the public.
attributes.background: PUSH BACK BREXIT negotiations for 1-2 years due to COVID-19; a centennial/unprecedented crisis. Prioritise the UK and EU governments' resources towards working together, securing economic, public health, medical measures to support the region.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300412.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
